column2: I have decided to hold a hanami and to invite my vassals to the celebration, but first it will be necessary for me to make sure that the necessary preparations have been seen to.
While my guests will be staying at my court for some time during the hanami I still need to decide whether the main event will take place during the day or the night.
I think I'll have it during the day!
The night would be more appealing!

During the preparations for the hanami I have considered various forms of entertainment for my guests. One option would be to hire some shirabyoshi to entertain my guests. Perhaps I should hire a few.
That would be a good idea!

My capital could perhaps use some embellishments during the hanami. The commoners would appreciate it, for one thing, and chances are the guests would like it too, even though they will most likely only experience it from afar.
Some modest decoarations would be worthwhile!
Some of the nearby [Root.Religion.GetName] shrines would doubtlessly appreciate it if I sent some offerings for the kami at the time of the hanami, and I could most likely spare the coin for that.
I will send a small offering!
I will send a grand offering!
I think a tainted offering would be best...
I see little reason for this...

Word has reached me that [From.GetBestName] is sending some offerings to a [From.Religion.GetName] shrine in preparation for an upcoming hanami. I believe I have the opportunity to taint these offerings, should I wish to use it.

My personal garden has seen better days, and with the guests having to spend time there to enjoy the cherry blossoms properly it might be a good idea to improve it ahead of the hanami so that they do not find anything to complain about.
I know how to do that!
I will need to have food prepared for the hanami. The question is, how much am I willing to spend on it?
With the preparations nearing completion it is time for me to invite my vassals to join me for the hanami.

[Root.GetTitledName]
, I hereby invite you to my upcoming hanami. I hope that you will find the time to attend.
By my hand and seal,
[From.GetTitledName]

[Root.GetTitledName]
, I have no interest in joining you for your hanami at this time, and have to decline your invitation.
By my hand and seal,
[From.GetTitledName]

The cherry blossoms are in full bloom in [Root.Capital.GetName], and it looks like it will be a beautiful day. As my vassals arrive from both near and far I look out across my garden with a smile on my face.\nHopefully, this will be a memorable occasion that is found satisfactory for everyone. If not, it is too late to do anything about it now. I wave over a nearby servant and give them a few quick instructions regarding the final preparations before heading down to greet one of the new arrivals.

The cherry blossoms are in full bloom in [Root.Capital.GetName], and hundreds of paper lanterns hang amongst them to illuminate the night. As my vassals arrive from both near and far I look out across my garden with a smile on my face.\nHopefully, this will be a memorable occasion that everyone finds satisfactory, but there are a thousand things that could go wrong. Of course, it is a bit late to worry about that now, and I do my best to put it out of my mind as I head down to greet one of the recent arrivals.

The cherry blossoms are in full bloom in [From.Capital.GetName] as my party arrives, and it looks like it will be a beautiful day. My liege, [From.GetTitledName], has invited vassals from both near and far, and I see both familiar faces and faces I barely recognize.\nThe hanami should be a memorable occasion, and I hope that I will have a good time, along with everyone else. Doubtlessly, [From.GetTitledName] has prepared for every eventuality, as [From.GetSheHe] has a smile on [From.GetHerHis] face as [From.GetSheHe] greets me.

The cherry blossoms are in full bloom in [From.Capital.GetName] as my party arrives, and hundreds of paper lanterns hang amongst them to illuminate the night. My liege, [From.GetTitledName], has invited vassals from both near and far, and I see both familiar faces and faces I barely recognize.\nThe hanami should be a memorable occasion, and I hope that everyone will have a good time. Given that [From.GetTitledName] seems unconcerned as [From.GetSheHe] greets me, there should be nothing to worry about.

[From.GetTitledName] has seen fit to extensively decorate [From.GetHerHis] capital for the hanami, and it truly is a sight to behold. Even if I ignore the cherry trees themselves, it is a most impressive display.

My servants inform me that they have overheard [From.GetTitledName] speak with approval of the decorations I saw fit to arrange for the people of my capital. Clearly, not only the commoners appreciate the display.

Aside from the cherry trees in [From.GetTitledName]'s garden and elsewhere [From.Capital.GetName] is almost entirely without decorations. It seems [From.GetTitledName] cannot be bothered to show off [From.GetHerHis] wealth.

It would seem [From.GetTitledName] has expressed [From.GetHerHis] dislike of the lack of decorations in [Root.Capital.GetName] where people could overhear [From.GetHerHim]. Perhaps I should have invested more in decorations...

My liege, [From.GetTitledName], has seen fit to send some offerings to a nearby [From.Religion.GetName] shrine as part of the hanami celebration, doubtlessly hoping that the kami will be pleased by this.
I should say that I approve...

Shortly after thanks arrived from the shrine I sent offerings to [From.GetTitledName] took the time to add [From.GetHerHis] own thanks to those of the priests at the shrine. It would seem that [From.GetSheHe] was impressed by my generosity.
It would seem that [From.GetTitledName] has not seen fit to send a proper offering to the kami at a nearby shrine. The priests did not see fit to complain, but I could still do that.
I will pretend to be outraged...

[From.GetTitledName] requested a word in private with me, and once we were away from the other guests [From.GetSheHe] angrily complained about the lack of a proper offering for the kami of a nearby shrine.

My attempt to taint the offerings sent to a shrine as part of the hanami has been successful. The priests sent a messenger thanking me profusedly for the offerings, which now pollute the shrine with unholy energies.

A priest arrived today from the shrine I sent offerings to, informing me that the offerings seemed unclean and that the priests had decided not to present them to the kami. However, I do not seem to be under suspicion.
It would seem the priests at the shrine I sent some tainted offerings to are a suspicious lot. The sabotage was discovered, and now fingers are being pointed my way. Nothing can be proven, but...

My tainting of the offerings [FromFrom.GetTitledName] sent to the kami at a nearby shrine went well. The priests have sent word that they are thankful for the offerings, and clearly they are not suspecting that their shine has been befouled.

My attempt to taint the offerings [FromFrom.GetTitledName] sent to the kami at a nearby shrine did not pan out. The priests discovered that something was awry with the offerings right away, even if my involvement does not seem to be suspected.
Word has reached me from the shrine I sent some offerings to that someone has attempted to pollute them. The priests are convinced that I am not to blame, but they cannot determine whose fault it is.

I attempted to taint the offerings [FromFrom.GetTitledName] sent to the kami at a nearby shrine, but this has turned out poorly. There is no proof, but I have heard whispers suggesting my involvement, and perhaps someone will believe them...

The hanami at [From.GetTitledName]'s capital is mainly taking place beneath the cherry trees in the garden. I have seen well-tended gardens in the past, but the garden of [From.GetTitledName] is one of the best I have encountered.

[From.GetTitledName] appears to be awestruck at the state of my garden, and has been heard praising the work that has been done there in preparation for the hanami. Evidently, I made the right decision to improve it.

While the cherry trees in [From.GetTitledName]'s garden are in full bloom, the effect is somewhat diminished by the poor state of the garden as a whole. It seems [From.GetTitledName] does not care about tending it at all.

I did not put a lot of effort into improving my garden before the start of the hanami, and [From.GetTitledName] appears to be horrified at the state of it as [From.GetSheHe] has been heard loudly complaining about it.

While [From.GetTitledName] has prepared some diversions during the hanami [From.GetSheHe] does not appear to have seen fit to hire any entertainers despite it being a perfect occasion to bring out some shirabyoshi to entertain everyone present.

[From.GetTitledName] has been complaining loudly about the lack of shirabyoshi where all of the guests could overhear [From.GetHerHim]. Perhaps I should have paid for some entertainment to avoid upsetting [From.GetHerHim] and everyone else.

The shirabyoshi I hired to entertain my guests did not show up on time, and as more and more time passes I slowly realize that they probably are not coming. Given that they have not seen fit to send an explanation they have probably just left with my money.

[From.GetTitledName] has been claiming that there would be shirabyoshi entertaining the guests at some point during the hanami, but they never made an appearance, and [From.GetTitledName] has offered no explanation as to why they did not.

The shirabyoshi I hired show up on time and start to entertain the guests with their music and dancing. However, I quickly realize that they are not particularly skilled in their chosen field, and the entertainment is not particularly enjoyable.
[From.GetTitledName] has hired some shirabyoshi to entertain everyone at the hanami, but they are not particularly good as their songs are off-key and their dancing is uncoordinated at best.

My [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledName], has hired some shirabyoshi to perform at [From.GetHerHis] hanami, and I find their entertainment inspiring. I have the opportunity to approach them to ask for advice on a certain skill.

It seems my [GetFromRelation] [From.GetBestName] has been inspired by the shirabyoshi I hired and has learned from them after talking with them for a while. Hopefully, this will be an advantage in the future.

As I take a walk amongst the cherry trees on my own I come across [troublesome_shirabyoshi.GetBestName]. I have always been curious about whether the shirabyoshi know how to use the swords they wear, and when I inquire about it [troublesome_shirabyoshi.GetBestName] suggests a duel to find out.

[From.GetTitledName] has approached me and let me know that [From.GetSheHe] and [troublesome_shirabyoshi.GetBestName] are planning to duel one another as [From.GetTitledName] wants to know if the shirabyoshi can fight or not.

My liege, [From.GetTitledName], has refused my request to duel [troublesome_shirabyoshi.GetBestName], claiming that that is not the kind of entertainment [From.GetSheHe] hired the shirabyoshi to perform.

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] and [troublesome_shirabyoshi.GetBestName] were apparently planning to fight a duel to find out if the latter only carries a sword for show or if she actually knows how to use it, but it would seem [From.GetTitledName] has forbidden it.
My liege, [From.GetTitledName], has approved my request to duel [troublesome_shirabyoshi.GetBestName]. As the final preparations are being made I need to determine how I will approach the duel.
I will hold back a bit!
[From.GetTitledName] will soon be fighting me in a duel to find out if I can fight or if my sword is just for show. I need to decide how I want to approach the duel carefully.

It seems [FromFrom.GetTitledName] and [troublesome_shirabyoshi] will soon be fighting a duel, supposedly because [FromFrom.GetTitledName] is curious about whether shirabyoshi know how to fight. Perhaps it will be for show, or perhaps the two combatants will try to kill one another.

The duel between me and [FromFrom.GetTitledName] is not over in an instant, but I gain the upper hand relatively quickly and keep the pressure up until I can manage to disarm the shirabyoshi.\n"The fight is yours, my [Root.GetLordLady]," she says, bowing her head.

[From.GetTitledName]'s duel against [troublesome_shirabyoshi.GetBestName] was a bit more drawn out than expected, but eventually [From.GetTitledName] prevailed. Surprisingly enough, [From.GetTitledName] still seemed convinced that [troublesome_shirabyoshi.GetBestName] was a competent fighter, complimenting her for putting up a good fight.

[From.GetTitledName]'s duel against [troublesome_shirabyoshi.GetBestName] was a bit more drawn out than expected, but eventually [From.GetTitledName] prevailed. However, instead of being a good winner [From.GetTitledName] decided to mock the shirabyoshi for thinking that she had a chance in the first place.

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] managed to win [FromFrom.GetHerHis] duel against [troublesome_shirabyoshi.GetBestName], even if it was not a quick victory. It seems as if the shirabyoshi impressed [FromFrom.GetTitledName], though, since [FromFrom.GetSheHe] saw fit to compliment her skills after the duel was over.

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] managed to win [FromFrom.GetHerHis] duel against [troublesome_shirabyoshi.GetBestName], even if it was not a quick victory. Upon disarming the shirabyoshi [FromFrom.GetTitledName] saw fit to be a poor winner and mocked the shirabyoshi for challenging [FromFrom.GetHerHim] in the first place.

[From.GetTitledName]'s duel against [troublesome_shirabyoshi.GetBestName] was a bit more drawn out than expected, but eventually [From.GetTitledName] prevailed. However, apparently simply disarming the shirabyoshi was not good enough for [From.GetTitledName] as [From.GetSheHe] decided to strike down the unarmed woman.

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] managed to win [FromFrom.GetHerHis] duel against [troublesome_shirabyoshi.GetBestName], even if it was not a quick victory. The shirabyoshi surrendered upon losing her sword, but [FromFrom.GetTitledName] did not see fit to let her live and struck her down.

My duel against [troublesome_shirabyoshi.GetBestName] goes on for quite some time with neither of us getting the upper hand, and eventually [FromFromFromFrom.GetTitledName] declares it a draw. I need to decide whether I should claim I held back or if I should acknowledge her skill.

[From.GetTitledName] and [FromFromFrom.GetBestName]'s duel went on for a considerable amount of time without either party getting the upper hand, and eventually you had to declare it a draw. Surprisingly, [From.GetTitledName] saluted the shirabyoshi and praised her skills.

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] and [FromFromFromFrom.GetBestName]'s duel was indecisive, and [From.GetTitledName] eventually had to call it a draw. Surprisingly enough, this outcome appears to have been acceptable for [FromFrom.GetTitledName] as [FromFrom.GetSheHe] saluted the shirabyoshi at the end.

[From.GetTitledName] and [FromFromFrom.GetBestName]'s duel went on for a considerable amount of time without either party getting the upper hand, and eventually you had to declare it a draw. [From.GetTitledName] loudly claimed that [From.GetSheHe] held back as [From.GetSheHe] sheathed [From.GetHerHis] sword.

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] and [troublesome_shirabyoshi.GetBestName]'s duel was indecisive, and [From.GetTitledName] eventually had to call it a draw. As [FromFrom.GetSheHe] sheathed [FromFrom.GetHerHis] sword, [FromFrom.GetSheHe] loudly claimed that [FromFrom.GetSheHe] was holding back.

My duel against [From.GetTitledName] is not completely one-sided, but I gain the upper hand eventually and manage to disarm [From.GetHerHim]. I could demand [From.GetHerHis] surrender at this point, or just strike [From.GetHerHim] down where [From.GetSheHe] stands.
All who oppose me must die!

My duel against [troublesome_shirabyoshi.GetBestName] does not go well. It is not entirely one-sided, but eventually the shirabyoshi prevails and manages to disarm me, and I am forced to yield. I might be able to claim that I did not fight at my full potential, should I wish to do so.

[From.GetTitledName]'s duel against [troublesome_shirabyoshi.GetBestName] was not particularly even, and eventually the shirabyoshi triumphed. Surprisingly enough, [From.GetTitledName] did not seem to have an hard feelings towards [troublesome_shirabyoshi.GetBestName], and instead praised her skills.

[From.GetTitledName] did not prevail in [From.GetHerHis] duel against [troublesome_shirabyoshi.GetBestName]. However, instead of trying to save face, [From.GetTitledName] decided to praise the shirabyoshi's skills after the fight was over, which seemed to please her.

[From.GetTitledName]'s duel against [troublesome_shirabyoshi.GetBestName] was not particularly even, and eventually the shirabyoshi triumphed. As the shirabyoshi walked away [From.GetTitledName] loudly proclaimed that [From.GetSheHe] was holding back the whole time.

[From.GetTitledName] did not prevail in [From.GetHerHis] duel against [troublesome_shirabyoshi.GetBestName]. As the shirabyoshi sheathed her sword and started to walk away [From.GetTitledName] started to claim that [From.GetSheHe] was holding back the whole time.

My duel against [troublesome_shirabyoshi.GetBestName] does not go well. It is not entirely one-sided, but eventually the shirabyoshi prevails and manages to disarm me. Before I have the chance to yield she raises her sword again and cuts me down.

[troublesome_shirabyoshi.GetBestName] managed to prevail against [From.GetTitledName] in their duel, and the shirabyoshi was not content with simply defeating her opponent. Before [From.GetTitledName] manages to surrender [From.GetSheHe] was cut down by [troublesome_shirabyoshi.GetBestName].

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] did not win [FromFrom.GetHerHis] duel against [troublesome_shirabyoshi.GetBestName], and the shirabyoshi was completely merciless on victory, striking [FromFrom.GetTitledName] down where [FromFrom.GetSheHe] stands.

Amongst the shirabyoshi I hired [remarkable_shirabyoshi.GetBestName] truly stands out as exceptional, and she offers to stay at my court after the hanami is over. This is too good an opportunity to turn down.
Stay as long as you like!

One of the shirabyoshi [From.GetTitledName] hired, [From.remarkable_shirabyoshi.GetBestName], has proven to be a far better performer than the average shirabyoshi, and I am not surprised when I learn that she will become a permanent member of [From.GetTitledName]'s court.

There is always a risk that the weather will be bad during the day of the hanami, which can ruin the experience, but the weather could not have been better this time, and everyone can fully enjoy the festivities.
I couldn't have picked a better date!
I have had some fun when spending my time with [From.hanami_friend_2.GetBestName] at [From.GetTitledName]'s hanami. Perhaps this is the start of a true friendship?
I think I have enough friends...

[From.GetBestName] appears to like my company at [FromFrom.GetTitledName]'s hanami quite a bit, and I also enjoy their company. It comes as no surprise when [From.GetBestName] suggests the two of us should become friends.
[From.GetBestName] seems to have enjoyed my company too, as [From.GetSheHe] is happy to declare me [From.GetHerHis] friend. Surely, this is the start of a beautiful friendship!

It would seem [From.GetBestName] has not enjoyed my company as much as I have enjoyed spending time with [From.GetHerHim], seeing as [From.GetSheHe] just told me that [From.GetSheHe] has no interest in becoming my friend friend.

During [From.GetTitledName]'s hanami [From.hanami_rival_2.GetBestName] has been extremely poor company, and I cannot help but to feel insulted by the way they speak to me. Perhaps I should demand an apology?
It's the least I am owed!
[From.GetBestName] appears to have taken some things I have said during [FromFrom.GetTitledName]'s hanami personally, and [From.GetSheHe] has demanded that I apologize for the things I have said.
I will never apologize! For anything!
[From.GetBestName] refused to apologize to me. It is clear that this is the start of a rivalry between the two of us, as [From.GetSheHe] clearly cannot be trusted to behave in a civilized fashion.
[From.GetBestName] apparently did not mean the things [From.GetSheHe] said before and has apologized over the perceived insult, seemingly sincerely sorry to have offended me.

During the hanami I come across [arguing_hanami_vassal_1.GetBestName] and [arguing_hanami_vassal_2.GetBestName] loudly arguing with one another. I cannot tell what the reason for their quarrel is, but perhaps I could try to smooth things over.

It seems my attempt to smooth things over has been successful, for [arguing_hanami_vassal_1.GetBestName] and [arguing_hanami_vassal_2.GetBestName] quickly calm down and are conversing as friends again by the time I am walking away from them.

During [From.GetTitledName]'s hanami I and and another vassal ended up arguing over a misunderstanding. Luckily, [From.GetTitledName] managed to clear up the misunderstanding and I now know that there was no reason to get angry.

My attempt to meddle in the argument between [arguing_hanami_vassal_1.GetBestName] and [arguing_hanami_vassal_2.GetBestName] did not go well, and they are now angry with both me and one another. Perhaps it would have been better if I had not meddled.

During [From.GetTitledName]'s hanami I and another vassal ended up arguing with one another. [From.GetTitledName] apparently thought that [From.GetSheHe] could be a diplomat and clear things up, but [From.GetSheHe] only made things worse.
This is not a minor misunderstanding!
A priestess from a nearby shrine made an unexpected appearance at my hanami, offering to say a few words and to make a small offering to the kami in my name after I welcomed her to the hanami.

As [From.GetTitledName]'s hanami continues I find myself talking to [From.hanami_lover_2.GetBestName], a very lovely [From.hanami_lover_2.GetManWoman]. I cannot tell for sure, but they might be interested in me in a romantic way, and it would be easy to slip away into the night with them if they agree to it...
I will try to seduce them!

I have been talking to [From.GetBestName] for quite some time at [FromFrom.GetTitledName]'s hanami and think that they are a fine [From.GetManWoman]. It does not surprise me particularly much when [From.GetSheHe] suggests that the two of us should find someplace private to get to know one another more closely.

[From.GetBestName] did not seem to appreciate my attempt to get to know them intimately, and [From.GetSheHe] hastily ended our conversation and hurried away. Hopefully, they will not speak of my suggestion with anyone else.

[From.GetBestName] was amenable to my suggestion to slip away into the darkness to get to know one another intimately, and it is not long before we find a secluded part of [FromFromFrom.GetTitledName]'s garden and start to get undressed.
It is good to be the [Root.GetTitle]!

I have taken a short break from the festivities and am taking a walk through a secluded part of my garden when I hear a sound from behind some bushes. I go around them and find [From.GetBestName] and [FromFrom.GetBestName] entwined with one another, neither of them wearing any clothes.
I wonder what my silence is worth...
[From.GetTitledName] stumbled upon me and [FromFromFrom.GetBestName] in a compromising position, but it appears that [From.GetSheHe] is content to keep it secret, at least for now.
[From.GetTitledName] stumbled upon me and [FromFrom.GetBestName] in a compromising position, but it appears that [From.GetSheHe] is content to keep it secret, at least for now.

[From.GetTitledName] discovered me and [FromFromFrom.GetBestName] together in a compromising position. Before either of us could speak [From.GetTitledName] asked us what [From.GetHerHis] silence is worth to us.

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] discovered me and [From.GetBestName] together in a compromising position. Before either of us can speak [FromFrom.GetTitledName] asked us what [FromFrom.GetHerHis] silence is worth to us.
Both [From.GetBestName] and [FromFrom.GetBestName] agreed to pay me to keep their tryst secret without any complaints.
I will keep it secret, then!

I could not get [hanami_lover_1.GetBestName] and [hanami_lover_2.GetBestName] to agree to any concessions in exchange for my silence, and this leaves me no option but to expose their tryst to everyone at the hanami.
[From.GetTitledName] has outed my tryst to everyone at the hanami, and since there is no possible way for me to attempt to cover up the situation the scandal is a fact.

[From.GetTitledName] somehow caught wind of the fact that [FromFrom.GetBestName] and [FromFromFrom.GetBestName] were sleeping together, and has outed their relationship to everyone at the hanami. Given that the two were discovered together in a state of undress there is no plausible alternative explanation.
It seems the sounds from my hanami carries well beyond my garden, seeing as some of the townspeople have sent a messenger asking me to try to quiet things down a bit so that they can sleep properly.

In the middle of the night I can see something or someone moving about in the darkness just at the edge of my vision. I cannot tell who or what it is, and it might just be my mind playing tricks on me, but that is not certain...
I have made sure that there is plenty of sake for the guests at my hanami, and I know for sure that there is enough to go around even if I have some. Surely there is no harm in drinking some?
The cherry blossoms at the hanami are certainly inspiring, and I find myself in the mood for writing some poetry. Perhaps I should challenge [From.GetTitledName] to a poetry contest?

[From.GetTitledName] appears to feel inspired by the cherry blossoms and has suggested that the two of us should compete with one another in a poetry contest. I can of course turn it down, but maybe it would be fun.
It would seem [From.GetTitledName] has no interest in poetry as [From.GetSheHe] turned down my challenge to a poetry content, claiming that [From.GetSheHe] had better things to do.
After I and my opponent have written our poems we hand them over to some of the other guests to read so that they may choose a winner. After some deliberation they decide that I have won.
After I and my opponent have written our poems we hand them over to some of the other guests to read so that they may choose a winner. After some deliberation they decide that I have lost.
[From.hanami_duel_vassal_2.GetBestName] has insulted me during the hanami, and I would be well within my rights to challenge them to a duel.
Apparently [From.GetBestName] feels that I have insulted [From.GetHerHim] at the hanami, and [From.GetSheHe] is now challenging me to a duel. However, if I apologize the duel could be avoided.
It appears [From.GetBestName] does not wish to fight me, seeing as [From.GetSheHe] instead has apologized for upsetting me. Perhaps it is for the best to let the matter rest.

It seems [From.GetBestName] and [FromFrom.GetBestName] have quarreled during the hanami and that only a duel could settle the matter. The duel has already taken place, and [From.GetTitledName] has triumphed.
It seems [From.GetBestName] and [FromFrom.GetBestName] have quarreled during the hanami and that only a duel could settle the matter. The duel has already taken place, and neither came out ahead.

It seems [From.GetBestName] and [FromFrom.GetBestName] have quarreled during the hanami and that only a duel could settle the matter. The duel has already taken place, and [FromFrom.GetTitledName] has triumphed.
I and [FromFrom.GetTitledName] fight one another for some time, and I eventually gain the upper hand, disarming them easily enough.
I and [FromFrom.GetTitledName] fight one another for some time, but it becomes clear that neither of us can get the upper hand, and eventually we decide to end the duel without a winner.
I and [FromFrom.GetTitledName] fight one another for some time, and they eventually gain the upper hand. Before long I have been disarmed.
I and [From.GetTitledName] fight one another for some time, and they eventually gain the upper hand. Before long I have been disarmed.
I and [From.GetTitledName] fight one another for some time, but it becomes clear that neither of us can get the upper hand, and eventually we decide to end the duel without a winner.
I and [From.GetTitledName] fight one another for some time, and you eventually gain the upper hand, disarming them easily enough.

It seems [From.GetBestName] and [FromFrom.GetBestName] have quarreled during the hanami and that only a duel could settle the matter. The duel has already taken place, and [From.GetTitledName] has triumphed.

It seems [From.GetBestName] and [FromFrom.GetBestName] have quarreled during the hanami and that only a duel could settle the matter. The duel has already taken place, and neither came out ahead in the duel.

It seems [From.GetBestName] and [FromFrom.GetBestName] have quarreled during the hanami and that only a duel could settle the matter. The duel has already taken place, and [FromFrom.GetTitledName] has triumphed.
[From.GetTitledName] has has several truly magnificient meals prepared for the hanami. Doubtlessly, [From.GetSheHe] would like to hear if [From.GetHerHis] guests liked the food.
[From.GetTitledName] has has several decent meals prepared for the hanami. Doubtlessly, [From.GetSheHe] would like to hear if [From.GetHerHis] guests liked the food.
[From.GetTitledName] has has several rather plain meals prepared for the hanami. Doubtlessly, [From.GetSheHe] would like to hear if [From.GetHerHis] guests liked the food.
Apparently, [From.GetTitledName] likes the quality of the food I had my servants prepare for the hanami and has seen fit to publicly praise you for it.
Apparently, [From.GetTitledName] does not like the quality of the food I had my servants prepare for the hanami and has seen fit to publicly complain about it.
As the hanami continues I come across [troublesome_shirabyoshi.GetBestName] several more times and find her company enjoyable. Perhaps the two of us should try to get to know one another better?
It seems [From.GetBestName] fancies me as [From.GetSheHe] has suggested that we should retire to [From.GetHerHis] bedchamber to get to know one another more intimately.
